DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Donor And/Or Hematopoietic Cell Graft Test Transplantation Transmission Genetic Disease or Disorder Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not the donor and/or product (graft) was tested for transplantable genetic diseases.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Donor And/Or Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Test Transplantation Transmission Genetic Disease or Disorder
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something._The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual._A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another._Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells._Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Donor And/Or Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Test
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Property.preferredName: Transplantation Transmission Genetic Disease or Disorder
Property.preferredDefinition: The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another.:Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells; inherited.:Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Concepts.definition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
A passage or transfer, as of a disease from one individual to another.
Having to do with information that is passed from parents to offspring through genes in sperm and egg cells.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Unk ND NA Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.
Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
